intro: Callerya sphaerosperma, commonly known as the globular pod callerya, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its unique, spherical seed pods that remain attached to the plant for an extended period. Its leaves are typically compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Callerya sphaerosperma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and distinctive floral display.
